subject: Sleep
title: Social Anxiety and Sleep Quality
description: A 60-second lesson on Social Anxiety and Sleep Quality.

hook.text: After a social event, you lie awake replaying every conversation, analyzing every awkward moment for hours.

buildup.text: Social anxiety involves intense post-event processing where the brain reviews interactions for perceived failures.

discovery.text: This rumination peaks at bedtime and delays sleep onset by an average of 30 to 45 minutes in anxious individuals.

twist.text: Sleep deprivation worsens social anxiety the next day, making future social events feel even more threatening.

climax.text: Good sleep restores prefrontal regulation, helping the brain evaluate social situations more accurately.

punchline.text: Bad sleep makes every social moment feel like a spotlight.

quiz.question: How does social anxiety affect sleep?
options: It causes people to sleep too much
Post-event rumination delays sleep onset by 30 to 45 minutes
It has no effect on sleep
